column2: For direct employees - Description of confidential whistleblowing or grievance mechanism e.g. web form, email, hotline (The mechanism itself must be published, not sufficient if they just say that they have it in place)
column3: For direct employees - How the whistleblowing or grievance mechanism is implemented, i.e. how the company responds to complaints and/or reported violations of policies and standards
column4: For direct employees - Discloses data about the number of reported violations or grievances filed, addressed and resolved
column5: For suppliers and vendors.  (No points given if onus is solely on the supplier to set up a grievance mechanism) - Description of confidential whistleblowing or grievance mechanism e.g. web form, email, hotline (The mechanism itself must be published, not sufficient if they just say that they have it in place)
column6: For suppliers and vendors.  (No points given if onus is solely on the supplier to set up a grievance mechanism) - How the whistleblowing or feedback mechanism is implemented, i.e. how the company responds to complaints and/or reported violations of policies and standards
column7: For suppliers and vendors.  (No points given if onus is solely on the supplier to set up a grievance mechanism) - How workers are informed of the whistleblowing or grievance mechanism (e.g. posted a wall or board in the facility; via a training session with facility workers)
column8: For suppliers and vendors.  (No points given if onus is solely on the supplier to set up a grievance mechanism) - If the whistleblowing procedure or grievance mechanism is included in the supplier/vendor policies e.g. Code of Conduct (The mechanism itself must be published, not sufficient if they just say that they have it in place)
column9: For suppliers and vendors.  (No points given if onus is solely on the supplier to set up a grievance mechanism) - Discloses data about the number of reported violations or grievances filed, addressed and resolved
